thread.title: Bill Clinton targets rural, energy issues in West Virginia
thread.title_full: Bill Clinton targets rural, energy issues in West Virginia

author: JONATHAN MATTISE Associated Press
title: Bill Clinton targets rural, energy issues in West Virginia
text:
Bill Clinton targets rural, energy issues in West Virginia By JONATHAN MATTISE Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story CHARLESTON, W.Va. 
Former President Bill Clinton says struggling rural regions like coal-dependent southern West Virginia should be the focus of new energy investments and infrastructure improvement. 
Clinton's 41-minute speech at the state party's Jefferson-Jackson Dinner Friday night focused more on rural issues than on promoting his wife, presidential hopeful Hillary Rodham Clinton. 
He questioned why there aren't assembly companies for windmills and solar plants investing in the state's coal-dependent reaches. 
He blasted Republican presidential hopefuls for criticizing government, and called Donald Trump a "master brander." 
Clinton's appearance is one of his first stops as he becomes more active on the campaign trail for his wife. 
He recently headlined fundraisers in Chicago, Atlanta and suburban Kansas City. He'll headline one in suburban Detroit this month. Related content
